data.title: Celeb Confirmed
data.meta_description: Hyeri, whose legal name is Lee Hye-ri, debuted as the youngest member of girl group Girl’s Day in October 2020. The girl group has released hits such as “Female President,” (2013), “Something,” (2014), “Darling,” (2014) and “Ring My Bell,” (2015). Though the group has not officially disbanded, no new music has been released  since 2019 and its four members — Hyeri, Yura, Sojin and Minah — are now all represented by different agencies. Hyeri debuted as an actor in 2012, through SBS weekend drama series “Tasty Life.” Her breakthrough role as an actor was as a lead in tvN drama series “Reply 1988,” which premiered in November 2015. She has acted in over a dozen drama series and two movies. The actor recently starred as the lead in MBC’s drama series “May I Help You.”
data.text: Hyeri, whose legal name is Lee Hye-ri, debuted as the youngest member of girl group Girl’s Day in October 2020. The girl group has released hits such as “Female President,” (2013), “Something,” (2014), “Darling,” (2014) and “Ring My Bell,” (2015). Though the group has not officially disbanded, no new music has been released since 2019 and its four members — Hyeri, Yura, Sojin and Minah — are now all represented by different agencies. Hyeri debuted as an actor in 2012, through SBS weekend drama series “Tasty Life.” Her breakthrough role as an actor was as a lead in tvN drama series “Reply 1988,” which premiered in November 2015. She has acted in over a dozen drama series and two movies. The actor recently starred as the lead in MBC’s drama series “May I Help You.”
